result.execSummary:
The defendant David J Koenig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: any other sentence defendant is serving.

miscConds.notes: Costs of $243 on Ct. 2 shall also be paid as a condition of probation on Ct. 1 (in addition to the costs due on Ct. 1).   If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.  Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered.

Defendant shall not enter establishments where the primary purpose is sale/service of alcohol. Defendant shall have no contact with the victims. Defendant shall not possess/consume any alcohol - defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall pay court costs as a condition of probation on Ct. 1.   Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

RECALLED Def in person & by Atty Jeffrey Morrell.  Atty Stephanie Hanson and DA Intern Samuel Tufford appeared for State. Guilty plea entered on Ct. 1 & 2.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1 & 2; Ct. 3 dismissed & read-in.. Statements by  Atty. Hanson. Statements by Atty. Morrell. Statements by defendant. Court proceeds to sentencing.
Def in person & by Atty Jeffrey Morrell.  Atty Peter John Cannon and DA Intern Samuel Tufford appeared for State. Case passed.
Victim does not request to be present for hearings
Hearing at 07-08-2015 01:15 pm

Def appeared in person.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Clerk: CP.  Def not eligible for SPD and req court appointed counsel.    Court appoints Atty Jeffrey Morrell.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate of $20 per month commencing 7-1-15.    Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
